metadata.key_specifications: IEC 61000-4-2 ESD protection up to ±30kV, IEC 61000-4-5 surge protection 7-60A (8/20µs), IO capacitance < 20pF, ultra low leakage 50nA max, industrial temp range -55°C to +150°C, SOD-323 package
metadata.applications: I/O Protection, Power Line Protection, USB VBUS, Grid infrastructure, Portable electronics

page_summaries.content:
TSDxx Unidirectional TVS Diodes in SOD-323
1 Features
• IEC 61000-4-2 ESD protection:
– ±30kV contact discharge
– ±30kV air gap discharge
• IEC 61000-4-5 surge protection:
– 7-60A (8/20µs)
• IO capacitance < 20pF (typical)
• Ultra low leakage current: 50nA (maximum)
• Industrial temperature range: –55°C to +150°C
• Industry standard SOD-323 leaded package 
(2.65mm × 1.3mm)
2 Applications
• I/O Protection
• Power Line Protection
• USB VBUS
• Grid infrastructure
• Portable electronics
3 Description
The TSDxx are a family of unidirectional TVS 
protection diodes designed for clamping harmful 
transients such as ESD and surge. The TSDxx 
devices are rated to dissipate ESD strikes up to 
±30kV (contact and air gap discharge) and also meets 
the maximum level specified in the IEC 61000-4-2 
international standard (Level 4).
Combining the robust clamping performance and low 
capacitance of this device, TSDxx are excellent TVS 
diodes to protect both data and power lines in many 
different applications.
The TSDxx family is offered in the industry 
standard, leaded SOD-323 package to enable easy 
solderability.

4 Pin Configuration and Functions

Figure 5-7. Positive TLP Curve - TSD24
Figure 5-8. Positive TLP Curve - TSD36
Figure 5-9. Capacitance vs Bias Voltage
Figure 5-10. Leakage Current vs Temperature
Figure 5-11. Temperature vs Capacitance - TSD05

6.1 Application Information
The TSDxx family are TVS diodes that provide a path to ground for dissipating transient voltage spikes (such as ESD or surge) on signal lines and power lines. Connect the device in parallel to the down stream circuitry for protection. As the current from the transient passes through the TVS, only a small voltage drop is present across the diode. The small voltage drop is presented to the protected IC. The low R DYN of the triggered TVS holds this voltage (VCLAMP) to a safe level for the protected IC. For more information on how to properly use this device, refer to the ESD Packaging and Layout Guide.

Product Summary.content: TSDxx Unidirectional TVS Diodes in SOD-323 are designed for clamping harmful transients such as ESD and surge. They offer IEC 61000-4-2 ESD protection up to ±30kV contact and air gap discharge, IEC 61000-4-5 surge protection up to 7-60A (8/20µs), ultra low leakage current of 50nA (maximum), and IO capacitance less than 20pF (typical).

The TSDxx family is suitable for applications like I/O Protection, Power Line Protection, USB VBUS, Grid infrastructure, and Portable electronics. They are designed to dissipate ESD strikes up to ±30kV and meet the maximum level specified in the IEC 61000-4-2 international standard (Level 4).

The TSDxx devices combine robust clamping performance and low capacitance, making them excellent TVS diodes for protecting both data and power lines across various applications. They are offered in the industry standard, leaded SOD-323 package (2.65mm × 1.3mm) for easy solderability and have an industrial temperature range of –55°C to +150°C.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Figure 5-7. Positive TLP Curve - TSD24, Figure 5-8. Positive TLP Curve - TSD36 (These figures likely show the positive transient latch-up performance curves for two different device models, TSD24 and TSD36, respectively. These curves are important for understanding the device's robustness against electrical overstress conditions.)

Figure 5-9. Capacitance vs Bias Voltage (This figure illustrates the relationship between the device's capacitance and the applied bias voltage, which is a critical electrical characteristic for many applications.)

Figure 5-10. Leakage Current vs Temperature (This figure shows how the device's leakage current varies with temperature, which is an important parameter for determining the device's performance and reliability over a range of operating conditions.)

Figure 5-11. Temperature vs Capacitance - TSD05 (This figure depicts the relationship between temperature and capacitance for the TSD05 device model, which is another key electrical characteristic that can impact the device's performance and behavior.)

Application Circuits.content: The TSDxx family are TVS diodes that provide a path to ground for dissipating transient voltage spikes (such as ESD or surge) on signal lines and power lines. Connect the device in parallel to the down stream circuitry for protection.

As the current from the transient passes through the TVS, only a small voltage drop is present across the diode. The small voltage drop is presented to the protected IC. The low R DYN of the triggered TVS holds this voltage (VCLAMP) to a safe level for the protected IC.
For more information on how to properly use this device, refer to the ESD Packaging and Layout Guide.

It includes a diagram showing the top view of the package and a table describing the functions of each pin (1 - I/O Protected Channel, 2 - GND Ground).

The text also includes notes on linear dimensions in millimeters, a disclaimer about the drawing being subject to change, and a diagram illustrating the package outline with dimensions.

Overall, this content covers key mechanical characteristics of the DYF package, including pin configuration, package outline dimensions, and form factor details essential for proper integration and mounting of the electronic component.

Packaging Information.content: 4 Pin Configuration and Functions: This section provides details about the pin configuration and functions of the electronic component. It includes details such as reel width, reel diameter, tape dimensions (cavity, sprocket holes, pitch between cavities), and quadrant assignments for pin 1 orientation in the tape.

Packaging Information Table: This table provides a comprehensive summary of the packaging information for the specific device package type (TSD05DYFR). It includes details like the package drawing, number of pins, standard pack quantity (SPQ), reel diameter, reel width, tape dimensions (A0, B0, K0, P1, W), and pin 1 quadrant.

Tape and Reel Box Dimensions: This section lists the dimensions of the tape and reel box used for packaging and shipping the electronic component. It includes the length, width, and height of the box for the specific device package type (TSD05DYFR).

Package Drawings and Notes: This chunk includes package drawings and notes related to the SOT(SOD-323) package type. It covers details such as maximum package height, solder mask tolerances, laser cutting apertures, stencil design recommendations, and references to relevant industry standards (IPC-7351, IPC-7525).
